page.title: 08DOWNE COURT MANOR- My Home
page.content:
HOME LIFE IN DOWNE
I live at Downe Court Manor. The house was built in 1689 and extended in 1837. Our house has 26 rooms and we have 40 acres of land including fields and a wood. We keep lots of animals. We have six horses, six chickens, three ducks, eleven doves, a cat and a great Dane which is used for guarding the house. My Dad works in London, but my mum stays at home to feed all the animals and clean the house. Some rooms have to be closed off in winter. We have a big farmhouse kitchen with a flagstone floor laid on the soil. When it rains the stones go darker. It is said that Queen Elizabeth I once visited our house to attend a chritening which makes it important for our local history.
